page.title: 09Ecology 2
page.content: Many pheasants and partridges can be seen in the fields . Wild rabbits, haresm hedgehogs, squirrels, molesand field mice are common. Bird life is extensive; common sparrows, blackbirds, thrushes, crows, yellow hammers, kestrels and magpies. The footpaths in this area are not signposted due to a decision by the Parish Council and are gradually being lost due to lack of usage. Opposite the Hadingham's farm there is a pond, wired off to the public and like the dykes and ponds found on either side of the Rushmere road they are green with algae. Very little other life exists in these waters probably due to fertilizers running off the fields. The hedgerows are a very attractive feature of this area with their wide verges full of grasses and beautiful wild flowers. Mnay have been removed.
